state.goal: Compile sindaring using ./scripts build then familiarise yourself with the language syntax, plan out loads of different scenarios for exploratory testing using as many combinations as you can come up with. Document any issues you find in ISSUES.md.

plan.goal: Compile sindaring using ./scripts build then familiarise yourself with the language syntax, plan out loads of different scenarios for exploratory testing using as many combinations as you can come up with. Document any issues you find in ISSUES.md.
plan.analysis: This is an exploratory testing task requiring building the compiler, understanding its syntax, generating comprehensive test scenarios with various feature combinations, and documenting any issues discovered during testing.

steps.description: Build the Sindarin compiler using ./scripts/build.sh and verify successful compilation
Read language documentation and sample files to understand full syntax (types, operators, control flow, functions, lambdas, string interpolation)
Design test scenarios for basic types and literals (int, double, str, char, bool with edge cases)
Design test scenarios for operators and expressions (arithmetic, comparison, logical, precedence combinations)
Design test scenarios for control flow (if/else, loops, nested structures, early returns)
Design test scenarios for functions (parameters, return types, recursion, lambdas, closures)
Design test scenarios for string interpolation with various embedded expressions
Design test scenarios for type inference, type errors, and edge cases
Execute all test scenarios systematically, running each through the compiler and runtime
Document all discovered issues in ISSUES.md with reproduction steps and expected vs actual behavior

plan.raw:
ANALYSIS: This is an exploratory testing task requiring building the compiler, understanding its syntax, generating comprehensive test scenarios with various feature combinations, and documenting any issues discovered during testing.

PLAN:
1. Build the Sindarin compiler using ./scripts/build.sh and verify successful compilation | simple
2. Read language documentation and sample files to understand full syntax (types, operators, control flow, functions, lambdas, string interpolation) | medium
3. Design test scenarios for basic types and literals (int, double, str, char, bool with edge cases) | medium
4. Design test scenarios for operators and expressions (arithmetic, comparison, logical, precedence combinations) | medium
5. Design test scenarios for control flow (if/else, loops, nested structures, early returns) | medium
6. Design test scenarios for functions (parameters, return types, recursion, lambdas, closures) | complex
7. Design test scenarios for string interpolation with various embedded expressions | medium
8. Design test scenarios for type inference, type errors, and edge cases | complex
9. Execute all test scenarios systematically, running each through the compiler and runtime | complex
10. Document all discovered issues in ISSUES.md with reproduction steps and expected vs actual behavior | medium

TOTAL_STEPS: 10
